Literature.Title: Tripropeptins, novel antimicrobial agents produced by Lysobacter sp. I. Taxonomy, isolation and biological activities.
Literature.Author: Hashizume H, Igarashi M, Hattori S, Hori M, Hamada M, Takeuchi T

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus 209P(MIC=0.78µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus Smith(MIC=0.78µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=0.78-1.56µg/ml),Micrococcus luteus IF03333(MIC=<0.2µg/ml),Micrococcus luteus PCI 1001(MIC=<0.2µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis NRRI B-558(MIC=0.39µg/ml),Bacillus cereus ATCC 10702(MIC=6.25µg/ml),Corynebacterium bovis 1810(MIC=0.39µg/ml),Escherichia coli NIHJ(MIC=>100µg/ml),Shigella dysenteriae JS1 1910(MIC=>100µg/ml),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Enteritidis(MIC=>100µg/ml),Proteus mirabilis IFM OM-9(MIC=>100µg/ml),Serratia marcescens(MIC=>100µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=>100µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae PCI 602(MIC=>100µg/ml),Mycobacterium smegmatis ATCC 607(MIC=100µg/ml),Candida albicans(MIC=>100µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis JCM 5803(MIC=12.5µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium JCM 5804(MIC=12.5µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis NCTC 12201(MIC=6.25µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium NCTC 12202(MIC=12.5µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis NCTC 12203(MIC=25µg/ml)
